channel.title: CVE Feed for OPTO 22 -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for OPTO 22 -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-40707|2023-08-24T16:05:48.352Z -- opto%2022 -- snap%20pac%20s1
item.description: There are no requirements for setting a complex password in the built-in web server of the SNAP PAC S1 Firmware version R10.3b, which could allow for a successful brute force attack if users don't set up complex credentials.

item.title: CVE-2023-40706|2023-08-24T16:04:32.945Z -- opto%2022 -- snap%20pac%20s1
item.description: There is no limit on the number of login attempts in the web server for the SNAP PAC S1 Firmware version R10.3b. This could allow for a brute-force attack on the built-in web server login.

item.title: CVE-2023-40710|2023-08-24T16:09:25.235Z -- opto%2022 -- snap%20pac%20s1
item.description: An adversary could cause a continuous restart loop to the entire device by sending a large quantity of HTTP GET requests if the controller has the built-in web server enabled but does not have the built-in web server completely set up and configured for the SNAP PAC S1 Firmware version R10.3b

item.title: CVE-2023-40709|2023-08-24T16:08:47.919Z -- opto%2022 -- snap%20pac%20s1
item.description: An adversary could crash the entire device by sending a large quantity of ICMP requests if the controller has the built-in web server enabled but does not have the built-in web server completely set up and configured for the SNAP PAC S1 Firmware version R10.3b

item.title: CVE-2023-40708|2023-08-24T16:08:23.730Z -- opto%2022 -- snap%20pac%20s1
item.description: The File Transfer Protocol (FTP) port is open by default in the SNAP PAC S1 Firmware version R10.3b. This could allow an adversary to access some device files.
